shortdesc.ph: Enables or disables dual-stream mode on the sender and sets the low-quality video stream.
Enables or disables the dual-stream mode and sets the low-quality video stream on the sender side.
Enables or disables dual-stream mode on the sending end and configures the low-quality stream.
Enables or disables dual-stream mode on the sender and sets the low-quality video stream.

p.codeblock: Future<void> enableDualStreamMode( {required bool enabled, SimulcastStreamConfig? streamConfig});
public abstract int EnableDualStreamMode(bool enabled, SimulcastStreamConfig streamConfig);

dlentry.dd: Deprecated: Deprecated since v4.2.0. Use instead.
Deprecated: Deprecated since v4.2.0. Use instead.
Deprecated: Deprecated since v4.2.0. Use instead.
Deprecated: Deprecated since v4.2.0. Use instead.

section.p:
You can call this method on the sending side to enable or disable dual-stream mode. Dual-stream refers to high-quality and low-quality video streams:
High-quality stream: High resolution and high frame rate video stream.
Low-quality stream: Low resolution and low frame rate video stream. After enabling dual-stream mode, you can call on the receiving side to choose whether to receive the high-quality or low-quality video stream.

You can call this method on the sender side to enable or disable dual-stream mode. Dual-stream refers to high-quality and low-quality video streams:
High-quality stream: High resolution and high frame rate video stream.
Low-quality stream: Low resolution and low frame rate video stream. After enabling dual-stream mode, you can call on the receiver side to choose to receive either the high-quality or low-quality video stream.

You can call this method on the sending end to enable or disable dual-stream mode. Dual-stream refers to high-quality and low-quality video streams:
High-quality stream: High resolution and high frame rate video stream.
Low-quality stream: Low resolution and low frame rate video stream. After enabling dual-stream mode, you can call on the receiving end to choose whether to receive the high-quality or low-quality stream.

You can call this method on the sender to enable or disable dual-stream mode. Dual-stream refers to high-quality and low-quality video streams:
High-quality stream: High resolution and high frame rate video stream.
Low-quality stream: Low resolution and low frame rate video stream. After enabling dual-stream mode, you can call on the receiver to choose to receive the high-quality or low-quality video stream.

ul.li: This method applies to all types of streams sent by the sender, including but not limited to camera-captured video streams, screen sharing streams, and custom captured video streams.
To enable dual-stream in multi-channel scenarios, call the method.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.
This method applies to all types of streams sent by the sender, including but not limited to camera-captured video, screen sharing, and custom video streams.
To enable dual-stream mode in multi-channel scenarios, call .
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.
This method applies to all types of streams sent by the sender, including but not limited to camera-captured video, screen sharing, and custom-captured video.
To enable dual-stream mode in multi-channel scenarios, call .
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.
This method applies to all types of streams sent by the sender, including but not limited to camera-captured video streams, screen sharing streams, and custom captured video streams.
To enable video dual-stream in multi-channel scenarios, call the method.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable dual-stream mode:
: Enable dual-stream mode.
: (Default) Disable dual-stream mode.
Configuration of the low-quality video stream. See . If mode is set to DisableSimulcastStream, then streamConfig will not take effect.

Whether to enable dual-stream mode:
: Enable dual-stream mode.
: (Default) Disable dual-stream mode.
Configuration for the low-quality video stream. See . When mode is set to DisableSimulcastStream, setting streamConfig has no effect.

Whether to enable dual-stream mode:
: Enable dual-stream mode.
: (Default) Disable dual-stream mode.
Configuration for the low-quality stream. See . When mode is set to disableSimulcastStream, setting streamConfig has no effect.

Whether to enable dual-stream mode:
: Enable dual-stream mode.
: (Default) Disable dual-stream mode.
Configuration of the low-quality video stream. See . When mode is set to DISABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM, setting streamConfig has no effect.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
